public_information: Participants: Wayne, Edward, Lauren, Helen, Michael, Joseph, Vincent
There exists at least one time that fits all participants schedules

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward PDDL solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the scheduling task. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems targeting the FastDownward PDDL solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file to solve the multi-agent scheduling task. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents you keep their actions and availability representations distinct.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. There are seven participants providing PDDL domains and problems that describe their availability. You must integrate their PDDL responses to produce a combined PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that finds a single 30 minute meeting time on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that is compatible with all participants. Keep in mind that agent PDDL responses may be partial or use different names for the same time slots. Do not assume unspecified availability; only integrate explicit availability and busy intervals. Keep actions and predicates for each participant distinct so the planning outputs can be traced to participants. Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with FastDownward that encodes the combined scheduling problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
